text: According to the Merriam-Webster.com Dictionary, a breakwater is "an offshore structure (such as a wall) protecting a harbor or beach from the force of waves." Here are some photos taken at the breakwater near the playground. When you turn away from the breakwater to face the opposite direction, you would see Marina Bay Sands in the distance. Understand that Pontian Shoal (in Malaysia) is much better. Can't wait to check it out.

Very close to the sea and can enjoy sea breeze and the view while waiting for your playing kids. The best is to come by bicycle since it's a little far off. Also, the nearest washroom will be only at the Marina Barrage.
Not easy to get to here, have to walk 15 minutes from nearest MRT
